1.  <a href="/introduction" class="decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100 no-underline hover:underline text-xs tracking-wide font-semibold uppercase flex items-center gap-1.5 contrast-more:underline contrast-more:decoration-current">Introduction</a>

# Quick start

Eager to get started? This quick start guide will help you familiarize yourself with the core concepts of dnd kit.

</div>

<div class="hint transition-colors rounded-md straight-corners:rounded-none circular-corners:rounded-xl overflow-hidden bg-info border-info theme-muted-tint:bg-info-solid/2 [html.sidebar-filled.theme-bold.tint_&]:bg-info-solid/2 text-sm grid grid-cols-[auto_1fr] mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-label="Information" role="note">

<div class="py-4 pl-4 text-info-subtle contrast-more:text-info">

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-[1.2em] mt-px leading-normal" />

</div>

<div class="p-4 pl-3 empty:p-0 -row-end-1 -col-end-1 space-y-3 [&_.hint]:border [&_pre]:border [&_pre]:border-neutral">

Before getting started, make sure you have followed the installation steps outlined in the <a href="/introduction/installation" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">Installation guide</a>.

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#context-provider" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Context provider

</div>

First, we'll set up the general structure of the app. In order for the <span class="cursor-not-allowed underline" state="closed">`useDraggable`</span> and <span class="cursor-not-allowed underline" state="closed">`useDroppable`</span> hooks to function correctly, you'll need to ensure that the components where they are used are wrapped within a <a href="/api-documentation/context-provider" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">&lt;DndContext /&gt;</code></a> component:

<div class="rounded-lg straight-corners:rounded-xs ring-1 ring-inset ring-tint-subtle flex flex-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0">

<div class="group/tabs inline-flex flex-row self-stretch after:flex-1 after:bg-tint-12/1 [&:has(button.active-tab:last-of-type):after]:rounded-bl-md" role="tablist">

<div class="relative group/hash flex items-center gap-3.5 [&:has(+_.active-tab)]:rounded-br-md [.active-tab+&]:rounded-bl-md [.active-tab_+_:after]:rounded-br-md after:transition-colors after:border-r after:absolute after:left-[unset] after:right-0 after:border-tint after:top-[15%] after:h-[70%] after:w-px px-3.5 py-2 last:after:border-transparent hover:text-tint-strong max-w-full truncate shrink-0 active-tab text-tint-strong bg-transparent [&.active-tab]:after:border-transparent [:has(+_&.active-tab)]:after:border-transparent [:has(&_+)]:after:border-transparent">

App.jsx

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1]">

<a href="#tab-app.jsx" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-normal" aria-label="Direct link to tab"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-3 self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong" /></a>

</div>

</div>

<div id="app.jsx" class="p-4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-app.jsx">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {DndContext} from '@dnd-kit/core';

import {Draggable} from './Draggable';
import {Droppable} from './Droppable';

function App() {
  return (
    <DndContext>
      <Draggable />
      <Droppable />
    </DndContext>
  )
}
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#droppable" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Droppable

</div>

<div class="mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0 flex flex-row gap-3 justify-center">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden after:block after:absolute after:-inset-0 after:pointer-events-none w-fit">

<img src="https://docs.dndkit.com/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F3633755066-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-legacy-files%2Fo%2Fassets%252F-MMujhzqaYbBEEmDxnZO%252F-MNQc_e_FVewH2dAwjx9%252F-MNQdykNUAckcRaS-rWa%252Fdroppable-large.svg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D18af3a4e-b911-4149-82af-5d67c7198eea&amp;width=768&amp;dpr=4&amp;quality=100&amp;sign=e52f37ee&amp;sv=2" class="block" style="max-width:100%;height:auto" data-testid="zoom-image" loading="lazy" data-fetchpriority="low" />

</div>

</div>

</div>

Next, let's set up your first **Droppable** component. To do so, we'll be using the `useDroppable` hook. The `useDroppable` hook isn't opinionated about how your app should be structured. At minimum though, it requires you pass a <a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/refs-and-the-dom.html" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100">ref<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon ml-0.5 inline size-3 links-accent:text-tint-subtle" /></a> to the DOM element that you would like to become droppable. You'll also need to provide a unique `id` attribute to all your droppable components.

When a **draggable** element is moved over your droppable element, the `isOver` property will become true.

<div class="rounded-lg straight-corners:rounded-xs ring-1 ring-inset ring-tint-subtle flex flex-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0">

<div class="group/tabs inline-flex flex-row self-stretch after:flex-1 after:bg-tint-12/1 [&:has(button.active-tab:last-of-type):after]:rounded-bl-md" role="tablist">

<div class="relative group/hash flex items-center gap-3.5 [&:has(+_.active-tab)]:rounded-br-md [.active-tab+&]:rounded-bl-md [.active-tab_+_:after]:rounded-br-md after:transition-colors after:border-r after:absolute after:left-[unset] after:right-0 after:border-tint after:top-[15%] after:h-[70%] after:w-px px-3.5 py-2 last:after:border-transparent hover:text-tint-strong max-w-full truncate shrink-0 active-tab text-tint-strong bg-transparent [&.active-tab]:after:border-transparent [:has(+_&.active-tab)]:after:border-transparent [:has(&_+)]:after:border-transparent">

Droppable.jsx

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1]">

<a href="#tab-droppable.jsx" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-normal" aria-label="Direct link to tab"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-3 self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong" /></a>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="droppable.jsx" class="p-4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-droppable.jsx">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useDroppable} from '@dnd-kit/core';

function Droppable(props) {
  const {isOver, setNodeRef} = useDroppable({
    id: 'droppable',
  });
  const style = {
    color: isOver ? 'green' : undefined,
  };
  
  
  return (
    <div ref={setNodeRef} style={style}>
      {props.children}
    </div>
  );
}
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#draggable" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Draggable

</div>

<div class="mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0 flex flex-row gap-3 justify-center">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden">

<div class="relative overflow-hidden after:block after:absolute after:-inset-0 after:pointer-events-none w-fit">

<img src="https://docs.dndkit.com/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F3633755066-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-legacy-files%2Fo%2Fassets%252F-MMujhzqaYbBEEmDxnZO%252F-MN0Kqdqp2CU1CxUV_hg%252F-MN0LCrhtymDDEQ6kaJj%252Fdraggable-large.svg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D16954bf4-1357-4890-9e99-a74ca336ddf1&amp;width=768&amp;dpr=4&amp;quality=100&amp;sign=151c59c1&amp;sv=2" class="block" style="max-width:100%;height:auto" data-testid="zoom-image" loading="lazy" data-fetchpriority="low" />

</div>

</div>

</div>

Next, let's take a look at implementing our first **Draggable** component. To do so, we'll be using the `useDraggable` hook.

The `useDraggable` hook isn't opinionated about how your app should be structured. It does however require you to be able to attach listeners and a ref to the DOM element that you would like to become draggable. You'll also need to provide a unique `id` attribute to all your draggable components.

After a draggable item is picked up, the `transform` property will be populated with the `translate` coordinates you'll need to move the item on the screen.

The `transform` object adheres to the following shape: `{x: number, y: number, scaleX: number, scaleY: number}`

<div class="rounded-lg straight-corners:rounded-xs ring-1 ring-inset ring-tint-subtle flex flex-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0">

<div class="group/tabs inline-flex flex-row self-stretch after:flex-1 after:bg-tint-12/1 [&:has(button.active-tab:last-of-type):after]:rounded-bl-md" role="tablist">

<div class="relative group/hash flex items-center gap-3.5 [&:has(+_.active-tab)]:rounded-br-md [.active-tab+&]:rounded-bl-md [.active-tab_+_:after]:rounded-br-md after:transition-colors after:border-r after:absolute after:left-[unset] after:right-0 after:border-tint after:top-[15%] after:h-[70%] after:w-px px-3.5 py-2 last:after:border-transparent hover:text-tint-strong max-w-full truncate shrink-0 active-tab text-tint-strong bg-transparent [&.active-tab]:after:border-transparent [:has(+_&.active-tab)]:after:border-transparent [:has(&_+)]:after:border-transparent">

Draggable.jsx

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1]">

<a href="#tab-draggable.jsx" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-normal" aria-label="Direct link to tab"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-3 self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong" /></a>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="draggable.jsx" class="p-4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-draggable.jsx">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useDraggable} from '@dnd-kit/core';

function Draggable(props) {
  const {attributes, listeners, setNodeRef, transform} = useDraggable({
    id: 'draggable',
  });
  const style = transform ? {
    transform: `translate3d(${transform.x}px, ${transform.y}px, 0)`,
  } : undefined;

  
  return (
    <button ref={setNodeRef} style={style} {...listeners} {...attributes}>
      {props.children}
    </button>
  );
}
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

As you can see from the example above, it really only takes just a few lines to transform your existing components into draggable components.

<div class="hint transition-colors rounded-md straight-corners:rounded-none circular-corners:rounded-xl overflow-hidden bg-success border-success text-sm grid grid-cols-[auto_1fr] mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-label="Success" role="note">

<div class="py-4 pl-4 text-success-subtle contrast-more:text-success">

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon size-[1.2em] mt-px leading-normal" />

</div>

<div class="p-4 pl-3 empty:p-0 -row-end-1 -col-end-1 space-y-3 [&_.hint]:border [&_pre]:border [&_pre]:border-neutral">

**Tips:**

- <div class="text-base leading-normal mr-1 flex min-h-lh min-w-6 items-center justify-center text-tint">

  <div class="before:font-var before:content-(--pseudoBefore--content)" style="--pseudoBefore--content:'';--font-family:Arial;font-size:min(1.5em, 24px);line-height:1">

  </div>

  </div>

  <div class="flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col space-y-2">

  For performance reasons, we recommend you use **`transform`** over other positional CSS properties to move the dragged element.

  </div>

- <div class="text-base leading-normal mr-1 flex min-h-lh min-w-6 items-center justify-center text-tint">

  <div class="before:font-var before:content-(--pseudoBefore--content)" style="--pseudoBefore--content:'';--font-family:Arial;font-size:min(1.5em, 24px);line-height:1">

  </div>

  </div>

  <div class="flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col space-y-2">

  You'll likely want to alter the **`z-index`** of your Draggable component to ensure it appears on top of other elements.

  </div>

- <div class="text-base leading-normal mr-1 flex min-h-lh min-w-6 items-center justify-center text-tint">

  <div class="before:font-var before:content-(--pseudoBefore--content)" style="--pseudoBefore--content:'';--font-family:Arial;font-size:min(1.5em, 24px);line-height:1">

  </div>

  </div>

  <div class="flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col space-y-2">

  If your item needs to move from one container to another, we recommend you use the <a href="/api-documentation/draggable/drag-overlay" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">&lt;DragOverlay&gt;</code></a> component.

  </div>

</div>

</div>

Converting the `transform` object to a string can feel tedious. Fear not, you can avoid having to do this by hand by importing the `CSS` utility from the `@dnd-kit/utilities` package:

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import {CSS} from '@dnd-kit/utilities';

// Within your component that receives `transform` from `useDraggable`:
const style = {
  transform: CSS.Translate.toString(transform),
}
```

</div>

### 

<div class="relative hash grid grid-area-1-1 h-[1em] border-0 opacity-0 group-hover/hash:opacity-[0] group-focus/hash:opacity-[0] md:group-hover/hash:opacity-[1] md:group-focus/hash:opacity-[1] -ml-6 pr-2">

<a href="#assembling-all-the-pieces" class="inline-flex h-full items-start leading-snug" aria-label="Direct link to heading"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="gb-icon self-center transition-colors text-transparent group-hover/hash:text-tint-subtle contrast-more:group-hover/hash:text-tint-strong size-4" /></a>

</div>

<div class="flex-1 z-1 max-w-full break-words text-start justify-self-start leading-snug">

Assembling all the pieces

</div>

Once you've set up your **Droppable** and **Draggable** components, you'll want to come back to where you set up your <a href="/api-documentation/context-provider" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><code class="sourceCode mandoc">&lt;DndContext&gt;</code></a> component so you can add event listeners to be able to respond to the different events that are fired.

In this example, we'll assume you want to move your `<Draggable>` component from outside into your `<Droppable>` component:

<div class="mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0 flex flex-row gap-3 justify-center">

To do so, you'll want to listen to the `onDragEnd` event of the `<DndContext>` to see if your draggable item was dropped over your droppable:

<div class="rounded-lg straight-corners:rounded-xs ring-1 ring-inset ring-tint-subtle flex flex-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0">

<div id="app.jsx-1" class="p-4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-app.jsx-1">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React, {useState} from 'react';
import {DndContext} from '@dnd-kit/core';

import {Droppable} from './Droppable';
import {Draggable} from './Draggable';

function App() {
  const [isDropped, setIsDropped] = useState(false);
  const draggableMarkup = (
    <Draggable>Drag me</Draggable>
  );
  
  return (
    <DndContext onDragEnd={handleDragEnd}>
      {!isDropped ? draggableMarkup : null}
      <Droppable>
        {isDropped ? draggableMarkup : 'Drop here'}
      </Droppable>
    </DndContext>
  );
  
  function handleDragEnd(event) {
    if (event.over && event.over.id === 'droppable') {
      setIsDropped(true);
    }
  }
}
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="droppable.jsx-1" class="p-4 hidden" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-droppable.jsx-1">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useDroppable} from '@dnd-kit/core';

export function Droppable(props) {
  const {isOver, setNodeRef} = useDroppable({
    id: 'droppable',
  });
  const style = {
    color: isOver ? 'green' : undefined,
  };
  
  
  return (
    <div ref={setNodeRef} style={style}>
      {props.children}
    </div>
  );
}
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="draggable.jsx-1" class="p-4 hidden" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab-draggable.jsx-1">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<div class="flex items-center justify-start gap-2 text-sm [grid-area:1/1]">

</div>

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React from 'react';
import {useDraggable} from '@dnd-kit/core';

export function Draggable(props) {
  const {attributes, listeners, setNodeRef, transform} = useDraggable({
    id: 'draggable',
  });
  const style = transform ? {
    transform: `translate3d(${transform.x}px, ${transform.y}px, 0)`,
  } : undefined;

  
  return (
    <button ref={setNodeRef} style={style} {...listeners} {...attributes}>
      {props.children}
    </button>
  );
}
```

</div>

That's it! You've set up your first <a href="/api-documentation/droppable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><strong>Droppable</strong></a> and <a href="/api-documentation/draggable" class="underline decoration-[max(0.07em,1px)] underline-offset-2 links-accent:underline-offset-4 links-default:decoration-primary/6 links-default:text-primary-subtle hover:links-default:text-primary-strong contrast-more:links-default:text-primary contrast-more:hover:links-default:text-primary-strong links-accent:decoration-primary-subtle hover:links-accent:decoration-[3px] hover:links-accent:[text-decoration-skip-ink:none] transition-all duration-100"><strong>Draggable</strong></a> components.

Pushing things a bit further

</div>

The example we've set up above is a bit simplistic. In a real world example, you may have multiple droppable containers, and you may also want to be able to drag your items back out of the droppable containers once they've been dragged within them.

Here's a slightly more complex example that contains multiple **Droppable** containers:

<div class="rounded-lg straight-corners:rounded-xs ring-1 ring-inset ring-tint-subtle flex flex-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full page-api-block:ml-0">

<div class="group/tabs inline-flex flex-row self-stretch after:flex-1 after:bg-tint-12/1 [&:has(button.active-tab:last-of-type):after]:rounded-bl-md" role="tablist">

<div class="w-full space-y-4">

<div class="group/codeblock grid shrink grid-flow-col overflow-hidden mx-auto page-width-wide:mx-0 w-full decoration-primary/6 print:break-inside-avoid max-w-3xl page-width-wide:max-w-full flip-heading-hash" aria-busy="false">

<span class="button-content truncate">Copy</span>

``` relative
import React, {useState} from 'react';
import {DndContext} from '@dnd-kit/core';

import {Droppable} from './Droppable';
import {Draggable} from './Draggable';

function App() {
  const containers = ['A', 'B', 'C'];
  const [parent, setParent] = useState(null);
  const draggableMarkup = (
    <Draggable id="draggable">Drag me</Draggable>
  );

  return (
    <DndContext onDragEnd={handleDragEnd}>
      {parent === null ? draggableMarkup : null}

      {containers.map((id) => (
        // We updated the Droppable component so it would accept an `id`
        // prop and pass it to `useDroppable`
        <Droppable key={id} id={id}>
          {parent === id ? draggableMarkup : 'Drop here'}
        </Droppable>
      ))}
    </DndContext>
  );

  function handleDragEnd(event) {
    const {over} = event;

    // If the item is dropped over a container, set it as the parent
    // otherwise reset the parent to `null`
    setParent(over ? over.id : null);
  }
};
```

</div>

</div>

</div>

``` relative
import React from 'react';

export function Droppable(props) {
  const {isOver, setNodeRef} = useDroppable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  const style = {
    color: isOver ? 'green' : undefined,
  };
  
  
  return (
    <div ref={setNodeRef} style={style}>
      {props.children}
    </div>
  );
}
```

``` relative
import React from 'react';

export function Draggable(props) {
  const {attributes, listeners, setNodeRef, transform} = useDraggable({
    id: props.id,
  });
  const style = transform ? {
    transform: `translate3d(${transform.x}px, ${transform.y}px, 0)`,
  } : undefined;

  
  return (
    <button ref={setNodeRef} style={style} {...listeners} {...attributes}>
      {props.children}
    </button>
  );
}
```
